description_txt: stated on June 16, 2015 in an interview with Sean Hannity on Fox News:
quote_txt: As a senator, Hillary Clinton "has her name on three laws in eight years."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2015 in a House floor speech:
quote_txt: "Two weeks ago, a man entered the world’s busiest airport in Atlanta, Georgia, carrying a loaded AR-15 automatic weapon with an extended-capacity, 100-round magazine."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2015 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "Here are the stats: Per population, we kill each other with guns at a rate 297x more than Japan, 49x more than France, 33x more than Israel."

description_txt: stated on June 21, 2015 in comments on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: The Confederate battle flag in South Carolina was first flown at the statehouse in 1961. "It was flown as a symbol of massive resistance to racial desegregation."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2015 in a website post:
quote_txt: "More than half of women under 30 who give birth do so outside of marriage..."

description_txt: stated on June 17, 2015 in a broadcast of "The Daily Show":
quote_txt: "Between 2010 and 2014, there was no net in-migration from Mexico."

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2015 in remarks at the White House:
quote_txt: "This type of mass violence does not happen in other advanced countries. It doesn’t happen in other places with this kind of frequency."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2015 in his presidential announcement speech:
quote_txt: The Democrats are "responsible" for "the swift, mindless drawdown of a military that was generations in the making."

description_txt: stated on June 2, 2015 in a speech:
quote_txt: My support from young voters -- those 18 to 24 --  in November 2014 was "largely unheard of for a Republican."

description_txt: stated on June 21, 2015 in comments on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: The original compromise for the Confederate battle flag in South Carolina "was to put it on the back side of the statehouse, out of public view so it would not have any appearance of sovereignty."

description_txt: stated on June 21, 2015 in comments on CNN:
quote_txt: The Confederate battle flag at the South Carolina statehouse "must fly at a height of 30 feet. Any changes -- taken down, or even at half-staff, if that can be done -- must be passed by a supermajority of the General Assembly."

description_txt: stated on May 18, 2015 in U.S. Senate:
quote_txt: "This March, for the first time in human history, the monthly average carbon dioxide in our atmosphere exceeded 400 parts per million. The range had been 170-300 parts per million for hundreds of thousands of years."

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2015 in his declaration for president:
quote_txt: "Texas now has the second-highest high school graduation rate in the country. And it has the highest graduation rate for African Americans and Hispanics."

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2015 in remarks to reporters:
quote_txt: On timing of announcement for president.

description_txt: stated on June 14, 2015 in the strip about Greg Abbott and the Jade Helm military exercise:
quote_txt: Greg Abbott "activated the state guard to monitor" Jade Helm 15 "in case the troops try to impose martial law, disarm innocent Texans, and detain them in tunnels beneath closed Walmart stores."

description_txt: stated on June 5, 2015 in a speech:
quote_txt: Says U.S. Senate opponent Ron Johnson "is opposed to all government-assisted student loans."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2015 in a press release:
quote_txt: Currently, almost 40 percent of people with HIV are not diagnosed until they already have developed AIDS. And that can be up to 10 years after they first are infected with HIV.

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2015 in comments on CNN:
quote_txt: "For most black people in the history of this country … it was illegal to pass as a white person. You were actually put in jail if you tried to pass."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2015 in his presidential announcement speech:
quote_txt: "Even our nuclear arsenal doesn't work. It came out recently they have equipment that is 30 years old. They don't know if it worked."

description_txt: stated on June 14, 2015 in an article on the Breitbart website:
quote_txt: Says the California flag was supposed to be a pear, not a bear.

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2015 in a post on Twitter:
quote_txt: "The gap between the very rich and everyone else in America is wider today than at any time since the 1920s."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2015 in his announcement speech at Miami Dade College:
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton "insists that when the progressive agenda encounters religious beliefs to the contrary, those beliefs ‘have to be changed.’ "

description_txt: stated on June 12, 2015 in a panel discussion on HBO's "Real Time with Bill Maher":
quote_txt: "After the 2001 and 2003 Bush tax rate cuts ... there was more money coming into the treasury."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2015 in his presidential announcement speech:
quote_txt: "When was the last time you saw a Chevrolet in Japan? It doesn’t exist, folks."

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2013 in a video with the Human Rights Campaign.:
quote_txt: On same-sex marriage.

description_txt: stated on June 5, 2015 in a speech at the state Democratic Party convention:
quote_txt: "The United States still ranks 20th in the world in access to broadband -- over 50 percent below the best nations."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2015 in his presidential announcement speech:
quote_txt: "Our real unemployment is anywhere from 18 to 20 percent. Don't believe the 5.6. Don't believe it."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2015 in his presidential announcement speech:
quote_txt: "The last quarter, it was just announced, our gross domestic product … was below zero. Who ever heard of this? It's never below zero."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2015 in a speech announcing his 2016 presidential campaign:
quote_txt: The Islamic State "just built a hotel in Syria."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2015 in a post on Facebook:
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton "has donated every cent she's ever earned from speaking fees to charity."
